Desc.entry: A registered charity that offers a service for blind and visually impaired people. Provides access to local news and events through a weekly audio recording (tapes and CDs) based on items from the Sheffield Star, Telegraph and other local papers, called Sheffield Talking News, which can be delivered free to people's homes. Also produces an occasional audio magazine of less newsy features called Sheffield Talkabout. Provides audio recordings covering local and national services available to the blind and visually impaired. Also provides a transcription service from printed material to audio recording. Produces audio recordings for organisations, eg Neighbourhoods and Community Care Directorate Services, and various Council committees. Volunteers to help produce the audio recordings are welcome.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Monday afternoons, Monday evenings (recording sessions) & Tuesday mornings (copying and despatch)
